This article presents the notion of Packages in the application.
There is no notion of packages in Owl/RDF schemas. However it can be useful to group classes in Owl/RDF schemas as classes are grouped in packages in object-oriented languages.
If the "Show Packages" property is selected in the , the tool will by default show classes as packages providing that:
The Class has no properties (no Data properties nor object properties)
The Class has at most one parent class (which is also a Package)
The Class has at least one subclass
It is possible to override this behavior to disallow some classes to be seen as packages, or on the contrary to force one class to be seen as a package. See for more information.
If the "Show Packages" property is selected, the left part of the GUI will present two trees:
The graph of Owl classes
The list of packages
